TEXT: The applicant is a NORP national , born in DATE and living in GPE . She is represented before the Court by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE the applicant filed a suit against ORG before the single - member first instance civil court ( monomeles protodikio ) of GPE about unfair dismissal submitting , inter alia , that her compensation had not been calculated correctly .
The case was heard on DATE .

On DATE the court found in favour of the applicant declaring her dismissal null and void and ordering the defendant to pay her MONEY , by way of salary arrears , and part of her costs and expenses . The applicant served the decision on ORG on DATE .
On DATE ORG appealed . The appeal was heard on DATE .

On DATE ORG ( Efetio ) of GPE upheld the appeal and considered that there was no unfair dismissal . According to the court , the applicant had changed duties before her dismissal ; as a result , ORG , when calculating her compensation , was not obliged to take into consideration a special allowance attaching to her previous duties .

On DATE the applicant appealed in cassation . A hearing was fixed for DATE . On CARDINAL DATE the applicant submitted additional grounds of appeal . On DATE the judge rapporteur submitted his report . On DATE the court decided to adjourn the examination of the appeal at the parties’ request . The appeal was heard on CARDINAL DATE . On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) quashed the judgment of ORG considering that the latter had ignored some evidentiary material . The case was sent back to ORG for re - examination .

On DATE the applicant asked ORG to fix a hearing . The case was due to be heard on DATE but the lawyers were on strike . On DATE the applicant asked the court to fix a new hearing date . On DATE the court adjourned the examination of the case . On DATE the applicant ’s case was heard by ORG , composed of different judges from those that had issued the judgment of CARDINAL DATE . On CARDINAL DATE ORG found in favour of ORG considering that the applicant had accepted that she had changed duties before her dismissal and that she was not entitled to the special allowance . Although the applicant was entitled to another allowance , ORG had not acted in bad faith in failing to take the latter into consideration when calculating her compensation . As a result , although the applicant could claim additional compensation , her dismissal was not null and void .

On DATE the applicant appealed in cassation for the second time . ORG heard the appeal on DATE and on CARDINAL DATE it quashed again the judgment of ORG on the ground that its reasoning was contradictory , vague and inadequate . The case was sent back to ORG for re - examination .

On DATE the applicant asked ORG to fix a hearing . ORG heard the appeal on DATE and on CARDINAL DATE it found again in favour of ORG because the applicant , prior to her dismissal , had accepted that she should not be receiving any of the allowances in question .

On DATE the applicant appealed in cassation for a third time . ORG heard the appeal on DATE and dismissed it on DATE . The text of the jugement was finalised on DATE . It was signed by the President on CARDINAL DATE . ORG served the judgment on the applicant on DATE .
